rounds.description: Welcome, Recruit! Let's start with the basics.

questions.problem: This function should return the sum of two numbers.

python.buggyCode:
def add(a, b):
    return a - b
python.correctCode:
def add(a, b):
    return a + b
possibleSolutions:
def add(a, b):
    return a + b

def add(a,b):
    return a+b
def add(a, b): return a + b

def add(a, b):
    return(a+b)
const add = (a, b) => a + b;
const add = (a, b) => { return a + b; };
public int add(int a, int b) { return a + b; }
int add(int a, int b) { return a + b; }

questions.problem: This function should return true if the number is even.

python.buggyCode:
def is_even(num):
    return num % 2 == 1
python.correctCode:
def is_even(num):
    return num % 2 == 0
possibleSolutions:
def is_even(num):
    return num % 2 == 0

def is_even(num):
    return num%2==0
def is_even(num): return num % 2 == 0

def is_even(num):
    return not num % 2
const isEven = (num) => num % 2 === 0;
const isEven = num => num % 2 === 0;
function isEven(num) { return num % 2 === 0; }
public boolean isEven(int num) { return num % 2 == 0; }
int isEven(int num) { return num % 2 == 0; }

questions.problem: Find the missing return statement.

python.buggyCode:
def greet(name):
    f"Hello, {name}!"
python.correctCode:
def greet(name):
    return f"Hello, {name}!"
possibleSolutions:
def greet(name):
    return f"Hello, {name}!"

def greet(name):
    return f"Hello, {name}!"
def greet(name): return f"Hello, {name}!"

def greet(name):
    return "Hello, " + name + "!"
const greet = (name) => `Hello, ${name}!`;
const greet = name => `Hello, ${name}!`;
function greet(name) { return `Hello, ${name}!`; }
public String greet(String name) { return "Hello, " + name + "!"; }
char* greet(char* name) { return "Hello"; }

questions.problem: This loop should print numbers from 1 to 5.

python.buggyCode:
for i in range(1, 5):
    print(i)
python.correctCode:
for i in range(1, 6):
    print(i)
possibleSolutions:
for i in range(1, 6):
    print(i)

for i in range(1,6):
    print(i)
for i in range(1, 6): print(i)
for (let i = 1; i <= 5; i++) { console.log(i); }
for (int i = 1; i <= 5; i++) { System.out.println(i); }
for (int i = 1; i <= 5; i++) { printf("%d\n", i); }

questions.problem: This function should get the last element of an array/list.

python.buggyCode:
def get_last(lst):
    return lst[len(lst)]
python.correctCode:
def get_last(lst):
    return lst[-1]
possibleSolutions:
def get_last(lst):
    return lst[-1]

def get_last(lst):
    return lst[len(lst)-1]
def get_last(lst): return lst[-1]

def get_last(lst):
    return lst[len(lst) - 1]
const getLast = (arr) => arr[arr.length - 1];
const getLast = arr => arr[arr.length - 1];
function getLast(arr) { return arr[arr.length - 1]; }
public int getLast(int[] arr) { return arr[arr.length - 1]; }
int getLast(int arr[], int size) { return arr[size - 1]; }

rounds.description: Nice work! Let's add a bit more challenge.

questions.problem: This function should check if a string/array is empty.

python.buggyCode:
def is_empty(lst):
    return len(lst) > 0
python.correctCode:
def is_empty(lst):
    return len(lst) == 0
possibleSolutions:
def is_empty(lst):
    return len(lst) == 0

def is_empty(lst):
    return len(lst)==0
def is_empty(lst): return len(lst) == 0

def is_empty(lst):
    return not lst

def is_empty(lst):
    return not len(lst)
const isEmpty = (arr) => arr.length === 0;
const isEmpty = arr => arr.length === 0;
function isEmpty(arr) { return arr.length === 0; }
public boolean isEmpty(String str) { return str.length() == 0; }
int isEmpty(char* str) { return strlen(str) == 0; }

questions.problem: This function should compare two values for equality.

python.buggyCode:
def is_equal(a, b):
    return a is b
python.correctCode:
def is_equal(a, b):
    return a == b
possibleSolutions:
def is_equal(a, b):
    return a == b

def is_equal(a,b):
    return a==b
def is_equal(a, b): return a == b
const isEqual = (a, b) => a === b;
const isEqual = (a, b) => { return a === b; };
function isEqual(a, b) { return a === b; }
public boolean isEqual(int a, int b) { return a == b; }
int isEqual(int a, int b) { return a == b; }

questions.problem: This function should multiply two numbers.

python.buggyCode:
def multiply(a, b):
    return a + b
python.correctCode:
def multiply(a, b):
    return a * b
possibleSolutions:
def multiply(a, b):
    return a * b

def multiply(a,b):
    return a*b
def multiply(a, b): return a * b
const multiply = (a, b) => a * b;
const multiply = (a, b) => { return a * b; };
function multiply(a, b) { return a * b; }
public int multiply(int a, int b) { return a * b; }
int multiply(int a, int b) { return a * b; }

questions.problem: This function should check if a number is positive (greater than zero).

python.buggyCode:
def is_positive(num):
    return num >= 0
python.correctCode:
def is_positive(num):
    return num > 0
possibleSolutions:
def is_positive(num):
    return num > 0

def is_positive(num):
    return num>0
def is_positive(num): return num > 0
const isPositive = (num) => num > 0;
const isPositive = num => num > 0;
function isPositive(num) { return num > 0; }
public boolean isPositive(int num) { return num > 0; }
int isPositive(int num) { return num > 0; }

questions.problem: This function should return the maximum of two numbers.

possibleSolutions: def max_num(a, b): return a if a > b else b

def max_num(a, b):
    return max(a, b)
const maxNum = (a, b) => a > b ? a : b;
function maxNum(a, b) { return a > b ? a : b; }
const maxNum = (a, b) => Math.max(a, b);
public int maxNum(int a, int b) { return a > b ? a : b; }
int maxNum(int a, int b) { return a > b ? a : b; }

questions.problem: This should create a copy of an array, not reference it.

python.correctCode:
def copy_list(lst):
    return lst.copy()
possibleSolutions:
def copy_list(lst):
    return lst.copy()

def copy_list(lst):
    return lst[:]
def copy_list(lst): return lst.copy()

def copy_list(lst):
    return list(lst)

def copy_list(lst):
    return [item for item in lst]
const copyArray = (arr) => [...arr];
const copyArray = arr => arr.slice();

questions.problem: This function has an infinite loop. Fix the counter update.
This should concatenate/merge arrays without modifying the original.

python.correctCode:
def combine(list1, list2):
    return list1 + list2
possibleSolutions:
def combine(list1, list2):
    return list1 + list2

def combine(list1,list2):
    return list1+list2
def combine(list1, list2): return list1 + list2

def combine(list1, list2):
    return [*list1, *list2]
const combine = (arr1, arr2) => arr1.concat(arr2);
const combine = (arr1, arr2) => [...arr1, ...arr2];

questions.problem: This should swap two values correctly.

python.buggyCode:
def swap(a, b):
    temp = a
    a = b
    b = a
    return a, b
python.correctCode:
def swap(a, b):
    return b, a
possibleSolutions:
def swap(a, b):
    return b, a

def swap(a,b):
    return b,a
def swap(a, b): return b, a

def swap(a, b):
    temp = a
    a = b
    b = temp
    return a, b
const swap = (a, b) => [b, a];
public void swap(int[] arr, int i, int j) { int temp = arr[i]; arr[i] = arr[j]; arr[j] = temp; }
void swap(int* a, int* b) { int temp = *a; *a = *b; *b = temp; }

questions.problem: This should double each value without modifying the original.

python.correctCode:
def double_values(numbers):
    return [n * 2 for n in numbers]
possibleSolutions:
def double_values(numbers):
    return [n * 2 for n in numbers]

def double_values(numbers):
    return [n*2 for n in numbers]
def double_values(numbers): return [n * 2 for n in numbers]

def double_values(numbers):
    return list(map(lambda n: n * 2, numbers))
const doubleValues = (arr) => arr.map(n => n * 2);
const doubleValues = arr => arr.map(n => n * 2);

questions.problem: This loop variable has a scope/closure issue.
This divide function doesn't handle division by zero.

python.buggyCode:
def divide(a, b):
    return a / b
possibleSolutions:
def divide(a, b):
    return None if b == 0 else a / b
const divide = (a, b) => b === 0 ? null : a / b;

questions.problem: This recursive factorial is missing its base case.

python.buggyCode:
def factorial(n):
    return n * factorial(n - 1)
possibleSolutions: def factorial(n): return 1 if n <= 1 else n * factorial(n - 1)
const factorial = (n) => n <= 1 ? 1 : n * factorial(n - 1);

questions.problem: This string copy is missing null termination.

python.buggyCode:
def copy_str(s):
    return s[:-1]
python.correctCode:
def copy_str(s):
    return s
possibleSolutions:
def copy_str(s):
    return s
def copy_str(s): return s

def copy_str(s):
    return s[:]

def copy_str(s):
    return str(s)
const copyStr = (str) => str.slice();
const copyStr = str => str;

questions.problem: This async function isn't awaiting the promise.

possibleSolutions: async def get_data(): return (await fetch_data()).json()

questions.problem: This palindrome checker fails on mixed case and punctuation.

python.buggyCode:
def is_palindrome(s):
    return s == s[::-1]

questions.problem: This memoization cache returns the wrong value.
This boolean logic has an error in the condition.

python.buggyCode:
def is_in_range(x, low, high):
    return x >= low or x <= high
python.correctCode:
def is_in_range(x, low, high):
    return x >= low and x <= high
possibleSolutions:
def is_in_range(x, low, high):
    return x >= low and x <= high

def is_in_range(x,low,high):
    return x>=low and x<=high
def is_in_range(x, low, high): return x >= low and x <= high

def is_in_range(x, low, high):
    return low <= x <= high
const isInRange = (x, low, high) => x >= low && x <= high;
function isInRange(x, low, high) { return x >= low && x <= high; }
public boolean isInRange(int x, int low, int high) { return x >= low && x <= high; }
int isInRange(int x, int low, int high) { return x >= low && x <= high; }

questions.problem: This array initialization has wrong bounds checking.

possibleSolutions:
def init_array(size):
    return list(range(size))

def init_array(size):
    return [i for i in range(size)]
const initArray = (size) => Array.from({length: size}, (_, i) => i);

questions.problem: This function loses context and arguments when called.
